definition: to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
to flood/to submerge/to drown/to irritate the skin (of liquids)/to delay

sentences.english: The operating parts are submerged in liquids, shaft seal has no leakage.
sentences.chinese: 液下泵工作部分淹沒在液體內。

sentences.english: The tsunami that followed engulfed the northeast and wiped out entire towns.
sentences.chinese: 隨後的海嘯淹沒了日本東北，吞沒了整個城鎮。

sentences.english: His words were drowned in a crash of thunder.
sentences.chinese: 他的話被一聲雷響所淹沒。

sentences.english: the day, with the noise of this little earth, drowns the silence of all worlds.
sentences.chinese: 白天以這小小的地球的喧擾，淹沒了整個宇宙的安靜。

sentences.english: Fear, mixed with a feeling of uncertainty, suddenly overwhelmed me.
sentences.chinese: 恐懼，混有一種感覺的不確定性，突然淹沒了我。

sentences.english: The water swamped the parks and the streets.
The waters were rising about the rock and would soon submerge it.
sentences.chinese: 水快漲到跟岩石一樣高了，很快就會淹沒它。

sentences.english: Some say love it is a razor , that leaves your soul to bleed.
sentences.chinese: 有人說愛情是一條河，會把柔嫩的蘆葦淹沒。

sentences.english: His voice was drowned by the coughing of the audience.
sentences.chinese: 他的聲音被聽衆的咳嗽聲淹沒了。

sentences.english: However government interests - often suspect - tend to over-ride such concerns.
sentences.chinese: 不過，政府利益趨向於淹沒這些疑問。

sentences.english: Maybe, it's just because of you.
sentences.chinese: 還是你的理智淹沒了我的善感。

sentences.english: Li Dawu stood in a flooded building in Wuhan, China, Friday.
sentences.chinese: 武漢星期五，李大武站在被洪水淹沒的房子前。

sentences.english: A wave of sentiment swept over her.
sentences.chinese: 一陣柔情像水浪一樣淹沒了她。

sentences.english: This is party members howled down the opposition.
sentences.chinese: 這個黨的成員以吼叫聲淹沒了反對的意見。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
(of a liquid) to boil/(of sentiments etc) to boil over/to flare up/to be impassioned
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
to cross over/to transcend/to cover distance/to overcome/to rise above
